name: inextricably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is unable to be separated, released, or escaped from: inextricably linked His name was inextricably linked with the environmental movement. The history of children's literature is inextricably tied to the marketplace. See
inextricable
More examplesFewer examplesHealth care is inextricably linked with the welfare of the population.The winter season and the sport of ice hockey are inextricably linked.The fate of the two men seems inextricably intertwined.
